conversation_context.content: Hi! I will let you know when a problem appears. Meantime you can ask me anything

A DDoS (Distributed Denial of Service) attack is an attempt to make a computer or network resource unavailable by overwhelming it with traffic from multiple sources. It is a type of cyber attack where the attacker floods the targeted system with a large amount of traffic in an attempt to overwhelm its resources, such as bandwidth or CPU. This can cause the system to become slow or unavailable, and can even lead to the system crashing. DDoS attacks are often used to disrupt online services or to extort money from organizations. They can be launched by individuals or groups, and can be difficult to detect and mitigate.
